TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCTransitionCrossFade extends Cocos2D.CCTransitionScene

Docs.summary: <para> <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTransitionCrossFade" />: Cross fades two scenes using the <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCRenderTexture" /> object. </para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTransitionCrossFade" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCRenderTexture" />

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float32 t, class Cocos2D.CCScene scene) cil managed
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Draw() cil managed

Docs.summary: Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node.
Docs.remarks: <para>Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:<list type="bullet"><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </description> </item> </list><para>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </para>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnEnter() cil managed

Docs.summary: Event callback that is invoked every time when enters the 'stage'. If the enters the 'stage' with a transition, this event is called when the transition starts. During onEnter you can't access a "sister/brother" node. If you override onEnter, you shall call its parent's one, e.g., Node::onEnter().
Docs.remarks: <para>Event callback that is invoked every time when <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /> enters the 'stage'. If the <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /> enters the 'stage' with a transition, this event is called when the transition starts. During onEnter you can't access a "sister/brother" node. If you override onEnter, you shall call its parent's one, e.g., <ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_node_1a35211ff3db90acb4bca5d92edd6f3dde" kindref="member">Node::onEnter()</ref>. </para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /><ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_node_1a35211ff3db90acb4bca5d92edd6f3dde" kindref="member">Node::onEnter()</ref>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnExit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Event callback that is invoked every time the leaves the 'stage'. If the leaves the 'stage' with a transition, this event is called when the transition finishes. During onExit you can't access a sibling node. If you override onExit, you shall call its parent's one, e.g., Node::onExit().
Docs.remarks: <para>Event callback that is invoked every time the <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /> leaves the 'stage'. If the <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /> leaves the 'stage' with a transition, this event is called when the transition finishes. During onExit you can't access a sibling node. If you override onExit, you shall call its parent's one, e.g., <ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_node_1a3a43c10832c787f6e2ca437c3ecc8dd3" kindref="member">Node::onExit()</ref>. </para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /><ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_node_1a3a43c10832c787f6e2ca437c3ecc8dd3" kindref="member">Node::onExit()</ref>
